page.title: 05Natural History.1.
page.content: {Ecology}The area is mainly arable but does include several old meadows, several ancient hedgerows, an old sandpit known locally as snugs pit, and a wood known as heavens wood. The area is criss crossed by many footpaths, many of which go from village to village and very well used today. The roadside verges are very important conservation areas especially as economic factors are preventing regular cutting and spraying; so many wild flowers are flourishing including orchids. Several lanes are listed by Essex County Council as conservation areas not to be developed at all. Animals indigenous to area include Badgers, Foxes, Rabbits and Deer, Grey squirrels are also numerous.
